content.p: Welcome to the OpenAMQ website. OpenAMQ is a commodity middleware platform that implements an industry-standard protocol - AMQP - as a high-performance server and client API.

AMQP is a standardised wire-protocol for high-performance message exchange between a server and a set of clients. It supports the standard models of point-to-point queuing, publish-subscribe, and file-transfer, in a modern and language-independent manner.

This is a fast open source implementation of AMQP that runs on all modern platforms (Linux, Win32, Solaris, other Unixes). OpenAMQ is written in ANSI C and is highly configurable for specific messaging scenarios or memory/performance constraints. It covers the spectrum from high performance in-memory pub-sub (handling tens of thousands of messages per second) to highly-reliable file-transfer (guaranteed delivery across falible networks).

Whatever your preferred language, you will find an OpenAMQ library or API that gives you seamless access to AMQP services. Most of the OpenAMQ clients use the standard JMS (Java Messaging Services) model, with extensions. It typically takes 1-2 days to start using OpenAMQ in your applications.
Of course, since AMQP is an open standard, you can write your own client layers. The average effort is about 10-20 days.
On this website you will find an overview of the software, downloadable source packages and published technical specifications.
